About the Package ================================ Kafka is a distributed publish-subscribe messaging system and a robust queue that can handle a high volume of data and enables you to pass messages from one end-point to another. Kafka is suitable for both offline and online message consumption. Kafka messages are persisted on the disk and replicated within the cluster to prevent data loss. It is built on top of the Zoo-Keeper synchronization service. It integrates very well with Apache Storm and Spark for real-time streaming data analysis.
So, it is used for stream processing, website activity tracking, metrics collection and monitoring, log aggregation, real-time analytics, CEP, ingesting data into Spark, ingesting data into Hadoop,CQRS, replay messages, error recovery, and guaranteed distributed commit log for in-memory computing (microservices).
=Supported versions= v2.1.0
=Setup= * Java version 7 or above should be installed on Agent OS. * Internet Connection should be available on Agent OS.
=Common Inputs= - Broker Address*: Provide Broker Server address including port. Multiple brokers can be provided as separated by comma. - SSL*: Specify whether SSL is enabled on the kafka server. - SSL Truststore Location: Provide location of the SSL Truststore. E.g.: /bin/client.trustore.jks - SSL Truststore Password : Provide password for given truststore. - SSL Keystore Location : Provide location of the SSL Keystore. E.g.: /var/private/ss/kafka.client.keystore.jks - SSL Keystore Password : Provide password for given keystore. - SSL Password : Provide SSL password.
=Actions= Following actions are supported
* Action name: PCK.AUTOMIC_APACHE_KAFKA.PUB.ACTION.SEND_MESSAGE * Action Description: This action sends a message to the Kafka broker.
